benchmark_details.name: iTRI-QA (Interactive Trained Research Innovator - Question Answering)
benchmark_details.overview: A tool for the development of a customized question-answer (QA) dataset tailored for the needs of researchers leveraging language models (LMs) to retrieve scientific knowledge in a QA format.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To streamline the process of creating customized QA databases for research-oriented applications using LMs.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The computational resources required for fine-tuning and deploying even medium-sized LLMs can be prohibitive.

data.source: PubMed and customized QA examples generated through domain expert input.

methodology.calculation: Evaluation metrics are calculated based on the performance of the fine-tuned models on test datasets.
methodology.interpretation: Lower evaluation loss indicates better model performance.
methodology.baseline_results: Llama-3.2-1B and Llama-3.2-3B model comparisons for QA generation performance.
methodology.validation: The methodology is validated through benchmarking experiments.
